creator: jerry.gadd@tecnomatix.com
text:
I have some gif images that do not appear in my PDF when I specify an external-
graphic.
The URLs are correct, as I can swap the images for ones that do not fail.
The gif images in question appear to be OK as I can view them in IE.

Hi,

Is it possible for you to upgrade to 0.20.5, and try again?

Is there any obvious difference between the GIFs that do work, and those that 
don't (larger/more colours/higher res)? Have you tried opening the GIFs in a 
photo editor, and saving them again (works sometimes for JPEG)?

If all of the above doesn't work, could you provide us with an example image 
that is not working?
creator: adelmelle@apache.org
jerry.gadd@tecnomatix.com
text:
I am unable to change the version of fop as it is a customers system.

I have tried opening and re-saving the images in MSOffice Photo Editor (and 
other application) with no change.

The images are larger and have more colors than the ones which work.
However if I convert the images to *.bmp they appear correctly.

creator: jerry.gadd@tecnomatix.com
text:
Created attachment 9927
This one doesnt work

same problem.

Some images just won't appear.
Example image (that will work on other server: 
http://www.idiensten.net/demo/2005/layout/idiensten.blauw.gif
(it's transparant!!!)

Working on WINXP with latest 0.20.5

Apache does see them (when browsing directory), but when asked he won't 
display in internet explorer... no idea why... (extra stuff make the gif to an 
error file?)
creator: apache-bug@idiensten.com
apache-bug@idiensten.com
text:
skip the last comment... didn't see it was for the fop. (error was in apache 
httpd 2 itself), same version number confused me

creator: pascal.sancho@takoma.fr
text: Fixed in FOP 0.94 and probably earlier versions

creator: gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
